name: Tiffany Cheng
descriptions: Tiffany Cheng is a resident of Tenpenny Tower in Fallout 3.

Tiffany Cheng spends most of her days avoiding her husband, drinking in the Federalist Lounge, or shopping down on the first level. She eats at the Caf√© Beau Monde and then returns to the Cheng suite and spends some time in her room before going to sleep.

topics.response_text: No!!! Don't!{in the middle of an attack against his town}

topics.topic_text: Do you know how I can get into the basement?
topics.response_text: Maybe try talking to Mister Tenpenny or Chief Gustavo. They're probably the ones who would know.{she doesn't have any idea but trying to be helpful}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: It's a lot better now with those Ghouls out of the picture!{self important but showing appreciation}

topics.topic_text: You put up with a lot from your husband, huh?
topics.response_text: Do you know he tried forming a committee to discuss the Ghoul situation? A committee! He made himself Chairman, of course.{fed up with her husband's silly ideas}

topics.topic_text: Isn't a wife supposed to honor and obey her husband?
topics.response_text: Ha! You try being married to my husband for five minutes. I dare you!{mocking her husband}
Is there something you want? If not, I'm busy telling my neighbors to ignore my husband and his silly committee to discuss the Ghoul situation.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: I could take a whole pack of Ghouls without breaking a sweat.
topics.response_text: That's terrific! A real man of action. That's just what we need!{happy to have a hero}

topics.topic_text: I've dealt with enough Ghouls to know I don't ever want to see one again.
topics.response_text: Yeah. They make me nervous. They certainly are disturbing looking.{thinking about something unpleasant}
I wish I could. I get nightmares from time to time.

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: It's very clean and safe here. Well, mostly safe. They say those Ghouls won't get in. But I don't know.{nervous}

topics.topic_text: You know anything about these Ghouls?
topics.response_text: They're living in the nearby tunnels. They scare me!{nervous}

topics.topic_text: Don't worry. I'll take care of the problem.
topics.response_text: Really? Chief Gustavo is going to want to hear about that. You should talk to him right away.{surprised but happy someone is finally taking care of problem}

topics.topic_text: It's only natural to be afraid of the unknown...
topics.response_text: Perhaps you're right. But, I prefer to keep my nightmares a fantasy and not test my luck with the real thing. Thank you very much.{self important indignation}
I wish I was as unconcerned as you.{mildly sarcastic}

topics.topic_text: How would you feel about having a few Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: It's my turn, eh? I'm still worried, but if the others are willing to let them live here, I guess I could try it. But they better behave!{hesitant but sincere}

topics.topic_text: It's wise to be afraid of Ghouls.
topics.response_text: I think so. I mean, something that ugly must be evil... right?{snob losing prejudice}

topics.topic_text: I've met these Ghouls. They seem friendly enough.
topics.response_text: Well... you seem like you know what you're talking about. I guess I'd be willing to give it a try. I might not spend much time with them.{letting go of prejudice}

topics.topic_text: Would you tell Mister Tenpenny that you wouldn't mind Ghoul neighbors?

topics.response_text: I just remembered I need to be someplace else.{self important snob}

conversation.response_text: What? Are you kidding me?! Mind your own damn business. I don't go turning lights on in your closet, do I? Jeez!{annoyed that he is prying into her personal life}
Why? You haven't seen him have you?!{doesn't want to run into her annoying husband}
Whatever. He loves those damn meetings, and that stupid "Community Manifesto" of his more than me. He hardly knows I exist!{annoyed with her husband}
Well. I guess I better get some food.{hungry and on her way to get food}
I'm tired as hell.{tired and heading off to bed}
Irving! God! Can't a woman get a little time to herself!?
Oh, all right. See you!{naively self important}
What are you doing, Dashwood?{confused and slightly suspicious}
